meanings.definition: To form into a mass or lump
meanings.sent1: She wadded up the paper and threw it in the trash.
meanings.sent2: He wadded the clay into a ball before shaping it into a vase.
meanings.sent3: The cat wadded itself into a cozy ball on the soft blanket.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions wadded up inside her, ready to burst.
meanings.sent5: The snow wadded into perfect snowballs for the snowball fight.

meanings.definition: To fill or line with wadding
meanings.sent1: The tailor wadded the jacket to make it warmer for winter.
meanings.sent2: She wadded the pillow with soft cotton for extra comfort.
meanings.sent3: The chef wadded the turkey with stuffing for Thanksgiving dinner.
meanings.sent4: The clouds wadded the sky, creating a fluffy blanket above.
meanings.sent5: He wadded the package with bubble wrap to protect the fragile items inside.

meanings.definition: A mass or lump of material, especially of soft material
meanings.sent1: She found a wadded-up piece of paper in her pocket.
meanings.sent2: The blanket had a wadded section where the puppy had been napping.
meanings.sent3: The wadded cotton formed a cloud-like shape in the sky.
meanings.sent4: The wadded fabric resembled a small mountain in the distance.
meanings.sent5: He discovered a wadded ball of socks hidden under the bed.
